metadata.title: CVE-2014-4715 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Yann Collet LZ4 before r119, when used on certain 32-bit platforms thatallocate memory beyond 0x80000000, does not properly detect integeroverflows, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial ofservice (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via acrafted Literal Run, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-4611.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4715` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
